Class DrawingX

  • java.lang.Object
    • DrawingObject
      • DrawingX

  • public class DrawingX
extends DrawingObject
    Author:
    Eric Sekyere A DrawingX is an extension of the DrawingObject abstract class. It is used to store the details pertaining to an X-shaped object for the drawing program.

    • Field Summary

      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      protected int x1 
      protected int y1

      This resizes a DrawingX object.

      This function determines whether the given point (px, py), where the user has clicked, hits any part of this X.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DrawingX

        public DrawingX(int x1,
                int y1,
                int x2,
                int y2)
        This constructs a new DrawingX object. The X is defined by its two opposite corners, (x1, y1) and (x2, y2).
        Parameters:
        x1 - x coordinate for the first corner
        y1 - y coordinate for the first corner
        x2 - x coordinate for the first corner
        y2 - y coordinate for the first corner

    • Method Detail

      • resizeObject

        public void resizeObject(int x1,
                         int y1,
                         int x2,
                         int y2)
        This resizes a DrawingX object. The two corners, (x1, y1) and (x2, y2), that define the X are updated.
        Specified by:
        resizeObject in class DrawingObject
        Parameters:
        x1 - x point for initial coordinate
        y1 - y point for initial coordinate
        x2 - x point for final coordinate
        y2 - y point for final coordinate

      • wasClicked

        public boolean wasClicked(int px,
                          int py)
        This function determines whether the given point (px, py), where the user has clicked, hits any part of this X.
        Specified by:
        wasClicked in class DrawingObject
        Parameters:
        px - the x point on one of the two lines
        py - the x point on one of the two lines
        Returns:
        true if provided coordinate hits any part of the object else false

      • getBoundingBox

        public java.awt.Rectangle getBoundingBox()
        This function returns a Bounding Box. A bounding box is the smallest rectangle that contains the X.
        Specified by:
        getBoundingBox in class DrawingObject
        Returns:
        a rectangular bonding box

      • drawObject

        public void drawObject(java.awt.Graphics2D g2)
        This function draws the X using the given Graphics2D context.
        Specified by:
        drawObject in class DrawingObject
        Parameters:
        g2 - a Graphics2D object use to draw the X shape
